intro: Diplostephium teretifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed devil's ivy, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its adaptability, it can thrive in a variety of soil types and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
